WRITING.TEXT: Count me in please. Ta!
:D That's kinda sweet. As long it wasn't a note complaining about your mums cooking or something

As a kid, I wrote many notes to future owners of the house (or whoever found the note), along with a few random items (coins from my motley collection of old currency - nothing special, just cheap foreign coins I found at jumble sales), or the occasional small toy. I used to wrap the note and gifts up in a plastic bag, and then post them through gaps between floorboards, holes in the wall, and other random places throughout the house.
Hopefully a kid found them, if anyone :-)
Look up Tommy Cooper if you've not heard him; this is a regular joke of his, and they all follow a similar format, so if you like this one you'll probably enjoy the rest of his material :-)

That was a beautifully written, and heartfelt, response. That op turned out to be lying diminishes it not one bit. I'm due to become a parent for the first time real soon, and found your description, and thoughts, of a parent you can trust, very powerful.
I preordered my Pixel from Google, them cancelled and ordered from carphonewarehouse instead so I could have on release day. May do the same with my Daydream too

WRITING.TEXT: [Toe stubbing](http://forgifs.com/gallery/d/260776-2/Toe-stubbing-fatality.gif)

I saw an x-ray of a guy with a dozen 3" nails in his head.
He was a carpenter, and had accidentally chopped off his hand whilst working with a circular saw.
He later explained that the pain was so great, that on losing his hand, he repeatedly shot himself in the head to put himself out of his misery. Remarkably he survived.
Sure x-ray is online, will have a look when not on mobile.
Oh, wow. Nice one :-) That is a cracking shot

I stopped off at this lake on a drive from Yosemite to the Grand Canyon, on a tour of the US from England. I'd seen pictures like this before, but it was something else to see it with my own eyes - America is one beautiful country. This place really was as spectacularly chilled out as it looked.

There are a bunch of free tutorials available, but the complete ones you need to purchase. Rather than a subscription though, you buy tokens and then buy videos for life with these. You can buy a lifetime subscription though for a few hundred bucks. Scenes do look very professional; I'm currently working through the natural environments ones and finding it excellent.
:D that's fantastic

Nominative Determinism refers to the phenomena of people's names being remarkably descriptive of their jobs. New Scientist magazine has a long running feature on them.
The last one I read about was a (NZ I think) government minister for food called Bevan Eats.
Also simplymaya - well worth the money.

In fact, it's part of a series of movies. It's apparently how humankind might look from an alien's (visitor to Earth) perspective. The sequel is: powaqqatsi
Also, /u/thisistehawesomes - if you like Koyannisqatsi, I highly recommend Baraka and Samsara. Both in a similar style, with sweeping landscapes, cut with snapshots of different cultural goings on.

There's an amazing story I read about a [national geographic camera man being brought injured animals as food by a, frankly huge and pretty happy looking, sea lion](https://www.google.co.uk/url?sa=t source=web rct=j url=http://news.nationalgeographic.com/news/2014/03/140311-paul-nicklen-leopard-seal-photographer-viral/ ved=0ahUKEwij4_eswofOAhVlBcAKHeeQBA0QFghJMAs usg=AFQjCNGhrfeTWyCfZAC5VUjHn_qmPcZz0Q sig2=3y-9stJu3VEx_pF842rGVw)
I know it's not a cat, but made me think of this :-)

That's the weird thing: whilst you can see the edge when in poly select mode, when in edge select mode I just couldn't select that edge running along the long side of that triangle. I ended up deleting both triangles, and recreating the quad.
Yes, I did extrude the shape from a some lines I attached together. It resulted in a non-standard poly which I then needed to cut up into different quads. Oddly, 3 of the quads were created fine, just the last one that was created with these triangles (same on the top of the extruded shape as the bottom too, in case this helps).

I've not encountered the connect tool yet, just working through some tutorials to get the basics. Will probably come across this in due course!
It's weird, because using the cut tool, it definitely brought up the snap cursor, so I would have expected it to automatically start the cut from the existing vertex, but I can see that this problem could arise easily by creating an extra vertex by mistake. Definitely something to look out for.
What would connect be used for typically, does it just automatically create an edge between two selected vertices?

Are you doing this in a in edit poly modifier?
I selected the modify tab, and the used the cut tool. Is this what you mean?
Sometimes, you might need to check if your "cut", perhaps didn't really connect to the correct vertex. Try single-clicking on your corner vertices and try dragging them, are there any duplicate verts floating around? If so, delete them or merge them to the other verts.
Yep, I tried grabbing and dragging the vertices, but there was definitely only one there!
Are any smoothing groups set to the face? Every quad will always be made of 2 polygons. Even though you might not see the edge lines. (you can use 'turn' in edge-mode to flip them over)
This sounds like it might have been it - I'll try and re-create it. I can see the 'turn' option now in the Edges section.
Thanks!

WRITING.TITLE: Why are triangle faces created when I cut a poly?
WRITING.TEXT:
Using 'cut' to breakdown an ngon into quads, I find that when i switch to face mode to select the new 4 sided faces, there are instead two triangles as per [this screenshot](http://i.imgur.com/ZgbQnAB.png)
The highlighted areas are where I've created cut the edges, from corner to corner.
I got around this by deleting both triangle faces, selecting the border edges and capping them to fill the hole - which created a 4 sided poly as expected.
I can't understand why max is creating these 3 triangle polys on certain faces for me? There wasn't an edge running down the middle of them, and there were no extra vertices that I could find. I really just want to know what is happening so I can stop it happening in the future!
(I'm a complete beginner to Max btw, but have a bit of Maya experience)
Roboticide
UK notes are different sizes which helps. However my blind colleague also has an iOS app which one identifies notes via the camera and let's him know what they are.

WRITING.TITLE: [SPOILER!] Weapon missing after reloading checkpoint
WRITING.TEXT:
This is only on level 2, in the locker room. I played this level, found the chainsaw in the locker room. I got a little further, and then quit to come back later. Don't have the chainsaw in my arsenal, and it's no longer in the locker room; I can see the corpse that did have it, almost cleaved in 2, but no chainsaw :-(
I'm assuming it'll be elsewhere in the game still, but just wondered if anyone else has found this?

WRITING.TITLE: [TOMT] Kids Sci-Fi picture book\short story
WRITING.TEXT: I would have read this in early years in school, around 83, 84 perhaps (UK). Very short picture book, with a few sentences per page. It was about a pair of children who were kidnapped by aliens, and who woke up on their ship. In the brief story, the kids escape, raided the ships armoury for some cool looking laser pistols, and then (I can't quite recall), somehow get back to Earth after defeating the aliens.
